snippet: As the Kurds seized Kirkuk, Sunni militants threatened to advance into the heavily Shiite south and destroy shrines there.
abstract: Kurdish forces exploit chaos in Iraq to seize control of strategic northern oil city of Kirkuk as government troops flee in face of advancing Sunni militants; insurgents warn officials of occupied Mosul to renounce allegiance to central government and threaten to destroy religious shrines sacred to Shiites.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO, SUADAD AL-SALHY and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Erbil, Suadad al-Salhy from Baghdad, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: As the Kurds seized Kirkuk, Sunni militants threatened to advance into the heavily Shiite south and destroy shrines there.

headline.main: Kurdish Fighters Take a Key Oil City as Militants Advance on Baghdad
headline.print_headline: Kurdish Fighters Take a Key Oil City as Militants Advance on Baghdad

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
